title: Data Matrix Structure Visualizer
description: Interactive visualization showing the structure of data matrices with rows as samples and columns as features, including heat map coloring and click-to-highlight functionality.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Linear Algebra
Data Science
Machine Learning
Data Matrices

learningObjectives: Identify rows as samples and columns as features in a data matrix
Extract a feature vector for a specific sample
Compare feature values across different samples
Recognize the dimensions n (samples) and d (features)
prerequisites: Understanding of matrices as arrays of numbers
Basic understanding of data and features

controls.label: Dataset
controls.description: Choose an example dataset to visualize

controls.label: Row Click
controls.description: Click a row to highlight it as a feature vector

controls.label: Column Click
controls.description: Click a column header to highlight one feature across all samples

controls.label: Cell Hover
controls.description: Hover over any cell to see its value

datasets.name: MNIST
datasets.description: Pixel values from handwritten digit image

learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of data matrix structure visualizer
Explore data matrix structure visualizer through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of data matrix structure visualizer to solve problems
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on data matrix structure visualizer
